key_points: New Orleans residents are facing uncollected garbage for weeks following Hurricane Ida.
Residents testified to a City Council committee about uncollected garbage since before the hurricane hit on Aug. 29.
Aaron "Louisiana" Grant proposed a Trash Parade on Facebook as a satirical protest, gaining over 1,900 interested participants.
Approximately 150 protesters participated in the parade, showcasing creativity in costumes to draw attention to the issue.
Grant sees humor as a coping mechanism in the aftermath of the disaster.
Despite the parade, garbage collection issues persist, with trash still visible everywhere.
New Orleans Mayor LaToya Cantrell acknowledged the garbage collection problems, attributing them to a workforce shortage exacerbated by Ida.
The city is seeking help from outside contractors to address the sanitation crisis.
Aaron Grant criticizes local government's failure to plan and prepare for such crises.
Grant compares the rapid assistance received by electrical and healthcare sectors to the lack of support for sanitation services post-Ida.
